questions.text: Which of the following best describes system software?
options: A. Software designed for user productivity
B. Software that manages computer resources
C. Software used for graphic design
D. Software for managing social media
questions.correctAnswer: B. Software that manages computer resources
questions.explanation: System software includes operating systems and utilities that manage and control computer hardware.

questions.text: True or False: An operating system acts as an intermediary between the user and the computer hardware.
questions.explanation: The operating system manages hardware resources and provides a user interface.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of user interface?
questions.explanation: A command-line interface allows users to interact with the operating system using text commands.

questions.text: Which operating system is commonly used in servers and enterprise environments?
questions.explanation: Linux is widely used in servers and enterprise environments due to its stability and flexibility.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a device driver?
options: C. To enable communication between the operating system and hardware devices
questions.correctAnswer: C. To enable communication between the operating system and hardware devices
questions.explanation: Device drivers are programs that allow the operating system to communicate with hardware devices like printers and graphics cards.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of system utility?
questions.explanation: Disk cleanup is a system utility that removes unnecessary files to free up disk space.

questions.text: True or False: A kernel is the core component of an operating system that manages system resources.
questions.explanation: The kernel is the central part of an operating system, managing hardware and system resources.

questions.text: Which type of software is responsible for managing hardware and providing an environment for running applications?
questions.explanation: System software, including operating systems, manages hardware and provides an environment for running applications.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a function of an operating system?
questions.explanation: Operating systems handle memory, file, and network management but are not used for video production.

questions.text: What does GUI stand for in computing?
questions.explanation: GUI stands for Graphical User Interface, which allows users to interact with software using graphical elements like icons and buttons.

questions.text: True or False: A file system is used to organize and store files on a storage device.
questions.explanation: File systems are used to manage and organize files and directories on storage devices.

questions.text: Which type of software provides tools for managing hardware and software resources on a computer?
questions.explanation: System software includes operating systems and utilities that manage hardware and software resources.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a desktop operating system?
questions.explanation: Windows 10 is a popular desktop operating system used on personal computers.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a mobile operating system?
questions.explanation: Android is a mobile operating system designed for smartphones and tablets.

questions.text: True or False: Multitasking allows multiple programs to run simultaneously on a computer.
questions.explanation: Multitasking enables multiple applications to run at the same time on an operating system.

questions.text: What is the primary function of an operating systemâ€™s file manager?
options: B. To manage files and folders
questions.correctAnswer: B. To manage files and folders
questions.explanation: The file manager in an operating system is responsible for organizing and managing files and directories.

questions.text: Which of the following is an open-source operating system?
questions.explanation: Linux is an open-source operating system that can be freely modified and distributed.

questions.text: Which command-line interface command is used to display the contents of a directory in Windows?
questions.explanation: The 'dir' command is used in the Windows command-line interface to display the contents of a directory.

questions.text: True or False: System utilities are software tools used to maintain and optimize system performance.
questions.explanation: System utilities like disk cleanup and defragmentation tools are used to maintain and optimize system performance.

questions.text: Which of the following is a security feature used to protect an operating system from unauthorized access?
questions.explanation: Password protection is a security feature used to restrict access to the operating system and files.

questions.text: Which of the following allows users to run multiple operating systems on a single physical machine?
questions.explanation: Virtualization allows multiple operating systems to run on a single physical machine using virtual machines.

questions.text: What is the function of the Task Manager in Windows?
questions.explanation: The Task Manager displays system performance and allows users to monitor and manage processes.

questions.text: True or False: An embedded operating system is used in specialized devices like ATMs and smart appliances.
questions.explanation: Embedded operating systems are designed for specialized devices and have limited functionality compared to general-purpose OS.

questions.text: Which of the following types of software is responsible for translating programming code into machine language?
questions.explanation: Compilers translate high-level programming code into machine language that can be executed by the CPU.

questions.text: Which operating system is developed by Apple and is used on Macintosh computers?
questions.explanation: macOS is developed by Apple and is used on Macintosh computers.

questions.text: Which of the following is a real-time operating system used in critical applications like industrial controls?
questions.explanation: Real-Time Operating Systems (RTOS) are used in critical applications that require real-time response.

questions.text: True or False: Disk fragmentation occurs when files are stored in non-contiguous clusters on a disk.
questions.explanation: Disk fragmentation happens when files are stored in different locations on the disk, slowing down access times.

questions.text: Which type of operating system allows multiple users to access and use the computer resources simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Multi-user operating systems allow multiple users to access the computer at the same time.

questions.text: Which of the following software tools can be used to diagnose and repair issues with a hard drive?
questions.explanation: A Disk Scanner is used to diagnose and repair issues such as bad sectors on a hard drive.

questions.text: Which of the following software tools helps to reduce disk fragmentation?
questions.explanation: Disk Defragmenter is used to rearrange fragmented files on a disk to improve access speed.

questions.text: True or False: Multithreading allows a single process to execute multiple threads simultaneously.
questions.explanation: Multithreading enables a single process to have multiple threads running concurrently.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of utility software?
questions.explanation: Utility software like Disk Cleanup helps maintain and optimize the system.

questions.text: Which of the following describes open-source software?
options: A. Software with a closed-source code
B. Software that can be freely modified and distributed
D. Software that cannot be edited
questions.correctAnswer: B. Software that can be freely modified and distributed
questions.explanation: Open-source software is freely available and can be modified and distributed by anyone.

questions.text: True or False: The boot process is the process of starting or restarting a computer and loading the operating system.
questions.explanation: The boot process initializes hardware and loads the operating system when a computer is started or restarted.

questions.text: Which of the following types of operating systems is designed to be used on embedded systems?
questions.explanation: Real-Time Operating Systems are designed for embedded systems and applications that require real-time responses.

questions.text: Which of the following commands is used to delete a directory in the Windows command-line interface?
questions.explanation: The 'rmdir' command is used to delete directories in the Windows command-line interface.

questions.text: True or False: A process in an operating system is an instance of a program in execution.
questions.explanation: A process is an instance of a program that is currently being executed by the operating system.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a shell in computing?
options: B. A software interface for accessing the operating system
questions.correctAnswer: B. A software interface for accessing the operating system
questions.explanation: A shell is a software interface that allows users to interact with the operating system using commands.

questions.text: Which of the following terms refers to temporarily storing data to free up RAM?
questions.explanation: Swapping temporarily moves data from RAM to a storage device to free up memory for other processes.

questions.text: True or False: A daemon is a background process that runs without user interaction.
questions.explanation: Daemons are background processes that run without user intervention to perform specific tasks.

questions.text: What is the main function of a task scheduler in an operating system?
options: B. To allocate CPU time to processes
questions.correctAnswer: B. To allocate CPU time to processes
questions.explanation: The task scheduler allocates CPU time to processes and manages task execution.
